com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common

Class DebugLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.DebugLogger

  • public class DebugLogger
extends java.lang.Object
    Enables logging debug data to console in an efficient and readable fashion. Optionally logged lines can be cached until a precondition is met. The logger will guarantee that two columns are kept at least 2 spaces apart.

    • Method Summary

      • addBlock

        public DebugLogger addBlock(org.bukkit.block.Block block)
        Accumulates the world and x/y/z axis of a Block without actually logging it. When all columns have been accumulated, call log() to log the line.
        Parameters:
        block -
        Returns:
        this logger

      • addVec

        public DebugLogger addVec(int decimals,
                          org.bukkit.util.Vector vec)
        Accumulates the x/y/z axis of a 3D vector without actually logging it. The precision at which the values are logged can be specified. When all columns have been accumulated, call log() to log the line.
        Parameters:
        decimals -
        vec -
        Returns:
        this logger

      • addNum

        public DebugLogger addNum(int decimals,
                          double... values)
        Accumulates additional column double values without actually logging it. The precision at which the values are logged can be specified. When all columns have been accumulated, call log() to log the line.
        Parameters:
        decimals -
        values -
        Returns:
        this logger

      • add

        public DebugLogger add(int... values)
        Accumulates additional column integer values without actually logging it. When all columns have been accumulated, call log() to log the line.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        this logger
